data.meta_site_name: Nostalgia Central – The way things used to be
data.text:
1 9 6 8 (UK)

7 x 30 minute episodes

This BBC comedy series based on the stories by P.G. Wodehouse featured the exploits of outrageous con man Stanley Featherstonehaugh (pronounced “fan-shaw”) Ukridge, played by Anton Rodgers.

Ukridge was a quick-witted – though rather incompetent – liar, thief, cadger (of money, tobacco, drinks and food) and layabout who only worked at crazy schemes that would never come off and for which other people would invariably have to pay.

Julian Holloway played Ukridge’s hapless chum Corky.

Stanley Featherstonehaugh Ukridge

Anton Rodgers

Corky

Julian Holloway

Aunt Julia

Marian Spencer

Tupper

Noel Davis

Barter

Hugh Latimer

Bowles

Episodes

The Home from Home | The Dog College | The Debut of Battling Billson | The Accident Syndicate | The Comeback of Battling Billson | The Nasty Corner | The Wedding Bells
